summary: This document appears to be an FBI interview summary (302 form) of an attorney's account of a phone call with Jeffrey Epstein on August 9, 2019. The attorney describes the content of the call, which included personal topics and Epstein's comments about his case and safety, with no indication he was suicidal. The attorney is identified as cooperating.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the phone call described by the attorney. He discussed the press, personal matters, his routine, his legal case, and assured the caller of his safety and love.

connections.description: The attorney spoke with Epstein by phone on August 9, 2019, discussing his case and personal well-being. The attorney is described as cooperating with authorities.

events.title: Phone Call Between Epstein and Attorney
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein spoke by phone with his attorney for approximately 20 minutes around 7 PM. They discussed the intense press coverage, personal topics (music, books, hygiene), his legal case timeline, and his assertion that 'They are trying to keep me safe.'

events.title: Attorney Interview / Cooperation Statement
events.description: The attorney was interviewed (likely by the FBI) and provided a narrative summary of the August 9th call with Epstein. The attorney stated there was no indication Epstein had decided to end his life and expressed willingness to continue cooperating.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein had a 20-minute phone call with his attorney on the evening of August 9, 2019, two days before his death.
During the call, Epstein stated 'They are trying to keep me safe' and said his case would take longer than originally thought.
Epstein told the attorney he loved her and wouldn't be able to call again for another month.
The attorney reported that nothing in the call indicated Epstein had decided to end his life, describing no acrimony.
The attorney is identified as willing to continue cooperating with authorities.
